957831874361024512.text: Very interesting use of @StakeTree to fund this must-read crypto newsletterhttps://twitter.com/stefanobernardi/status/957526867598290946 …

1116643478870593537.text: Thanks again for all the support you  all gave this project last year. Appreciate it a lot!

1116643372763156480.text: Update time! StakeTree lives on in @GetGitcoin Grants -https://medium.com/@StakeTree/staketree-lives-on-in-gitcoin-grants-33a6212ec9ee …

1012664854836961281.text: Sorry for being so silent. Lots have been happening behind the scenes. Here's a long awaited update on StakeTree. Good news, it's still going to continue within another team. Stay tuned for more on news for that.https://twitter.com/nieldlr/status/1012662784608350208 …

966622217743323141.text:
Here's the February update! March is going to be exciting with the current momentum 
https://medium.com/@StakeTree/february-update-talks-funding-contract-dashboard-more-7b7aa397ccef …pic.twitter.com/IdSM0GgcGv

966223198957207552.text: Stay tuned for end of month February update! v0.0.1 of the serverless contract dashboard is looking good (in fact the screenshot below comes directly from the service hosted on IPFS). A few more quirks to iron out still, but expect code on Github soon too!pic.twitter.com/DpTr6nzee8

964051327495131136.text: P.S. - This pulls in lots of newly published staketree code. Like the react components & a web3 controller. Keep an eye out on Github for all this pretty soon. Excited to share!

964050935935889409.text: You can host it yourself or access it locally with just a browser + internet. It'll be published to IPFS as well. So even if http://StakeTree.com  goes down, you'll be able to access your contracts.

964050612513116160.text: Happy Thursday! Quick update. Almost done with extracting the 1st service, the contract dashboard, into its own home. It all builds it into a single html file + js bundle.pic.twitter.com/9s50iCPN0o

954302164876386304.text: The next steps for StakeTree . Oak Forest (public beta release) planned for end of Q1 2018! Read more here:https://medium.com/@StakeTree/oak-forest-the-public-beta-release-coming-soon-d398611ed8dd …

952902751196823552.text: Tiny sneak peak! Been a productive week last week planning the next few months. Excited to share this will you all soon. Stay tuned! #opensource #decentralized #ethereumpic.twitter.com/7cZVpN7kVw

942689763777302528.text: Excited to join the #ethcommons. A sustainable future starts with all of us. Looking forward to @StakeTree's role in this -https://medium.com/@StakeTree/staketree-joins-the-ethereum-commons-1f4e33f41746 …

940944614441267200.text: Still can't believe I have people like Julien, and 16 others, who are at the frontier along with me. True innovators. Just incredible. So grateful for the support! https://twitter.com/bneiluj/status/940937484795596803 …

940885919644741632.text: 3/ Only the beneficiary (aka creator) would be able to update this page & update their IPFS hash. Excited to bring this self-serve setup to everyone in 2018 :)

940885635254177792.text: 2/ Part of the consideration is how to make this as decentralized as possible. From today, creator page content, is hosted on IPFS. Eventually, when you create your own page, this will automatically be uploaded to IPFS & the hash will be stored in a registry contract.

940885061469077504.text: 1/ Quick update: while the X-Over-Y contract is still being audited (ran into a few considerations to address), I've been working on making it simple for anyone to sign up for a creator page.

936568508753874944.text: While the new contract design is being audited, here's a sneak peek of the UI being built for the X-Over-Y funding contracts.pic.twitter.com/y6V7pY1Vo5

935827377195798528.text: 5/ A key reason for this new contract is to reduce the capital cost for funders to generate an income for a creator. Also, it makes it much clearer how much funding you are giving for how long.

935826111145172992.text: /4 After that, implementing the UI for it, and full steam ahead with onboarding some users to get more feedback.

935825899097853952.text: This'll be slightly different. And I can see creators being able to choose between them for what suits their needs. I've been building this contract last week & working on getting audits done now.

935825572772614144.text: 2/ Instead of pooling funds to a 10% withdrawal rate. Funders will be able to fund X amount of ether over Y withdrawals. Example: 0.1 ether over 5 weeks. Which means the beneficiary can withdraw 0.02 ether each time for 5 weeks.

935825153971408898.text: 1/ Update time! Been chatting to some potential users for early feedback & found a new contract design that could help some of them. I call it a X-Over-Y contract.

930787113213353984.text: Beta testing is ready for deploying new contracts & interfacing with them on a dashboard. Ping me on here or send an email to nieldlr@gmail.com to join!pic.twitter.com/6GBsZirVXX

928998352976523264.text: To be clear, there's many dapps already working financially. Just not sure if I've seen something that might work for StakeTree. Excited to chat about them all

928994192357052416.text: Stay tuned next week! I'll be sharing my vision for StakeTree's business model. I would really enjoy all feedback. Building dapps & making it work financially is still unsolved (but excited to try some novel approaches).https://twitter.com/nieldlr/status/928993526641197057 …

928963412150968320.text: A little spider has come to laugh at my bugs (and why I keep getting an invalid opcode error!)pic.twitter.com/rZcV7oFqzO

928955074176528384.text: Working on some more beneficiary options from my sister's farm in the middle of South Africa this week. Views are pic.twitter.com/Xt7dGFzDF9

928916162536198144.text: The first withdrawal on the new contract went through successfully! You can now start claiming your Stake Tree tokens if you were a funder at https://staketree.com/dev

927817387574996992.text: This will be live pretty soon :)

927817126097903616.text: Inspired by the spificator UX pattern, I decided to implement my own take on this, showing feedback when a transaction occurs on StakeTree.pic.twitter.com/WDmuXz2NAA

926424894400815105.text: TFW when you send your 1st email newsletter asking people to follow this Twitter account for updates but forget to link it.pic.twitter.com/tXsCdpumNa

926416277345796096.text: It's live! Check it out on the dev fund page. https://staketree.com/dev https://twitter.com/StakeTree/status/926390133527638016 …

926390133527638016.text: New interface for funders/beneficiary I'm working on. Coming soon! Lots of other work in the background too.pic.twitter.com/oSU6GoPhD6

925734287898488832.text: Stay tuned on how you can claim tokens when a withdrawal occurs next week!

925733963821445120.text: If you funded the MVP contract you can refund yourself & contribute to the new contract again!

925733762050248705.text: Big update today! The contract now has the ability to add tokenization for funders:https://medium.com/@StakeTree/sunsetting-the-mvp-now-with-tokenization-4b4be1339b71 …

923859459461525504.text: Creators will be able to switch on tokenization at any time. So it's totally optional.

923858860179447808.text: Tokenizing funder contributions work is going awesomely! Will be using the amazing MiniMe token contracts. Fully ERC-20 complaint!pic.twitter.com/A9A0Gh2Vgs

923115219475488768.text: Development is going smoothly! Stay tuned for more on this!

923115075937980422.text: With tokenized contracts, funders can receive a more tangible reward for their contributions. I've figured out how this could work.

923114788900823040.text: Wednesday update! The contract factory is working smoothly, but it's not quite live yet. Hoping to launch this with the tokenized contracts.

921387472138981377.text: Still on the testnet for now while ironing out more kinks in the UI.

921387190692864000.text: UI slowly coming together  Still have to consider to what extent defaults will be adjustable. For now, making it simple+easy is the goalpic.twitter.com/VTaz67XmTz

921283800868454400.text: Once the UI is working smoothly, migrating to the mainnet is the next step!

921283675471433728.text: The contract factory is working smoothly on the Rinkeby testnet. Now building out the UI/page so anyone can deploy it!pic.twitter.com/owG2PZDCDL

920985989715283968.text: Currently working on a contract factory so it'll be easy for users to deploy the StakeTreeMVP contract right from the browserpic.twitter.com/goWNoTdWuN

920916710991056896.text: Success! The 1st StakeTree withdrawal went through smoothly. Thanks to everyone for contributing already! https://etherscan.io/tx/0xb4f41e415b95911bee5169f9e9f5f639f59ad6a06f7b17965dad24bde1148d0c …

919169523089100800.text: 3/ Lastly, check out the transparent roadmap. Excited to keep sharing more short/mid/long terms plans:https://trello.com/b/ThPpLwFm/staketree-transparent-roadmap …

919169318486724608.text: 2/ An FAQ was also added explaining a few more things. This will always be updated/worked on https://www.staketree.com/faq

919169081554751488.text: 1/ The 1st creator page is live! https://www.staketree.com/dev  - You can fund, refund & withdraw from here. It also shows the contract details.

918406199149723653.text: Currently working on getting creator pages up & running. It will read the details straight from the contract. What do you think so far?pic.twitter.com/VzQBJ79Sb7
